intro: Scyphularia appressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scyphularia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by distinctive, spiny seed heads. Scyphularia appressa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
